qas.question: When did Elizabeth support constitutional amendments in Canada?
What politician criticized the proposed changes?
In 1987 what elected government was removed in a coup?
What did coup leader Sitiveni Rabuka declare Fiji to be?
In 1991 what money issue of the Queen was a feature of public criticism?
What government was Pierre Trudeau prime minister of in 1987?
In what year did Ratu Sir Penaia Ganilau become Governor-General of Fiji?
In what year did It's a Royal Knockout air?
Who was one of the younger royals who appeared on It's a Royal Knockout?
Who in the press made estimates about the Queen's private wealth?

context: In <a0_0><b6_0>1987<b6_0/><a0_0/>, in Canada, Elizabeth publicly supported politically divisive constitutional amendments, prompting criticism from opponents of the proposed changes, including <a1_0>Pierre Trudeau<a1_0/>. The same year, the elected <a2_0><b5_0>Fijian government<b5_0/><a2_0/> was deposed in a military coup. Elizabeth, as monarch of Fiji, supported the attempts of the Governor-General, Ratu Sir Penaia Ganilau, to assert executive power and negotiate a settlement. Coup leader <b8_0><b9_0>Sitiveni Rabuka<b9_0/><b8_0/> deposed Ganilau and declared Fiji a <a3_0>republic<a3_0/>. By the start of <b7_0>1991<b7_0/>, republican feeling in Britain had risen because of press estimates of the Queen's <a4_0>private wealth<a4_0/>—which were contradicted by the Palace—and reports of affairs and strained marriages among her extended family. The involvement of the younger royals in the charity game show It's a Royal Knockout was ridiculed and the Queen was the target of satire.
